description: Comprehensive scenario pack for all aviation operations

scenarios.SA: Captain monitoring instruments notices airspeed trend but doesn't project impact on approach configuration timing.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to continue approach with deteriorating weather vs. go-around vs. divert.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating an abnormal situation to cabin crew without causing passenger alarm.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating task sharing during high-workload phase with inexperienced first officer.
scenarios.LEAD: Captain managing crew resource dynamics when first officer challenges a decision.
scenarios.HF: Pilot fatigue effects after overnight flight crossing multiple time zones.

scenarios.SA: Flight attendant notices passenger behavior change but doesn't connect to medical emergency signs.
scenarios.DM: Deciding how to handle intoxicated passenger before situation escalates.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating security concern to flight deck using established protocols.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating emergency positions and duties during irregular operation.
scenarios.LEAD: Purser managing cabin team morale during extended delay with difficult passengers.
scenarios.HF: Attention to detail degradation on fourth flight segment of the day.

scenarios.SA: Ramp agent notices aircraft position but doesn't anticipate conflict with adjacent arrival.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to delay pushback for late-connecting passengers vs. on-time departure.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating cargo loading discrepancy to operations and flight deck.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating turn activities between fueling, catering, cleaning, and baggage.
scenarios.LEAD: Ramp lead managing team through weather delay with multiple aircraft queued.
scenarios.HF: Physical fatigue effects on baggage handler during peak departure bank.

scenarios.SA: Dispatcher monitoring weather sees current conditions but doesn't project impact on later departures.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to reroute multiple flights vs. delay vs. cancel given developing weather.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating operational changes to multiple stakeholders simultaneously.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating between crew scheduling, maintenance, and gate assignments.
scenarios.LEAD: Operations manager leading team through cascading delays affecting hub operations.
scenarios.HF: Decision quality degradation during extended irregular operations shift.

scenarios.SA: Mechanic notices wear pattern but doesn't connect to potential system issue.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to defer maintenance item vs. ground aircraft for immediate repair.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating maintenance status to dispatch and flight crew with accurate timeline.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating heavy check activities between multiple specialized teams.
scenarios.LEAD: Lead mechanic managing crew through AOG situation with time pressure.
scenarios.HF: Inspection accuracy after multiple hours of detailed work.

scenarios.SA: Gate agent notices boarding pace but doesn't project impact on departure time.
scenarios.DM: Deciding how to handle overbooked flight with multiple volunteer options.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating delay information to passengers clearly and with appropriate updates.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating between gate, ramp, and flight crew for on-time departure.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team during irregular operations with frustrated passengers.
scenarios.HF: Emotional labor effects on customer service quality after difficult interactions.

scenarios.SA: Cargo agent notices shipment weight but doesn't connect to aircraft balance implications.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to accept late freight vs. maintain load plan integrity.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating dangerous goods information to flight crew accurately.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating loading sequence between cargo, baggage, and catering.
scenarios.LEAD: Cargo supervisor prioritizing competing shipments during capacity constraint.
scenarios.HF: Documentation accuracy when processing high volume of shipments.

scenarios.SA: Security officer notices passenger behavior but doesn't connect to screening avoidance pattern.
scenarios.DM: Deciding response level for passenger who refuses secondary screening.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating security concern through proper channels without creating panic.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating checkpoint operations during high-volume period.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team during security incident with terminal impact.
scenarios.HF: Vigilance decrement after extended hours of screening operations.

scenarios.SA: Controller tracks current aircraft positions but doesn't project conflict 10 minutes ahead.
scenarios.DM: Deciding sequencing priority between emergency aircraft and multiple holding aircraft.
scenarios.COMM: Issuing clear, unambiguous instructions during high-traffic complexity.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating handoffs between approach and tower during weather.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing position staffing during unexpected traffic surge.
scenarios.HF: Cognitive load effects during peak traffic with multiple frequencies.

scenarios.SA: Fuel tech notices gauge reading but doesn't connect to potential contamination indicator.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to stop fueling operation when anomaly is detected.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating fueling discrepancy to operations and flight crew.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating fueling with other ramp activities during quick turn.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing team response to fuel spill incident.
scenarios.HF: Verification accuracy during repetitive fueling operations.

scenarios.SA: Catering staff notices temperature deviation but doesn't project food safety implications.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether to load questionable food items vs. short-cater the flight.
scenarios.COMM: Communicating special meal requirements and loading status to cabin crew.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating catering delivery with aircraft arrival and other turn activities.
scenarios.LEAD: Supervisor managing catering operation during multiple delays.
scenarios.HF: Food safety compliance accuracy during high-pressure operations.

scenarios.SA: Instructor notices trainee performance pattern but doesn't connect to underlying skill gap.
scenarios.DM: Deciding whether trainee is ready for checkride vs. needs additional training.
scenarios.COMM: Providing constructive feedback that addresses performance without damaging confidence.
scenarios.TW: Coordinating training schedule with line operations and crew availability.
scenarios.LEAD: Training manager addressing standardization issue across instructor group.
scenarios.HF: Evaluation accuracy when fatigued from multiple training sessions.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Weather Diversion
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Multiple aircraft diverting to alternate airport. Requires coordination of crew duty times, passenger rebooking, and ground handling at unplanned station.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Security Incident
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Security breach detected after passenger boards aircraft. Terminal evacuation, aircraft hold, and passenger rescreening required.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Mechanical AOG
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Aircraft goes mechanical at outstation with no maintenance coverage. Requires ferry flight decision, passenger reaccommodation, crew reassignment.

crossDepartmentScenarios.title: The Medical Diversion
crossDepartmentScenarios.scenario: Medical emergency requiring diversion to nearest suitable airport. Coordination of medical resources, aircraft handling, and passenger care.
